snippet: The Brooklyn artist Martha Rosler is to recreate a 1973 work at the Museum of Modern Art and is inviting donations of unwanted items.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; the Museum of Modern Art will recreate Meta-Monumental Garage Sale, multimedia installation and performance by Martha Rosler first presented in 1973; Kiki Smith installation Chorus will open in Times Square on May 23; exhibition of works by Philadelphia artist Karen Kilimnik is on view at Greenwich, Conn, property owned by publisher Peter Brant; works by Turkish artist Kutlug Ataman are on view at Sperone Westwater gallery.
lead_paragraph: The Brooklyn artist Martha Rosler is to recreate a 1973 work at the Museum of Modern Art and is inviting donations of unwanted items.

headline.seo: MoMA Plans Martha Rosler’s ‘Garage Sale’ for Its Atrium
headline.main: MoMA Plans a ‘Garage Sale’ for Its Atrium
headline.print_headline: Hey, Want to Buy My White Elephant?
